page.title: 02WOOLHOPE LANDSCAPE (1)
page.content: {Woolhope Dome - a famous Geological {feature. } This well known example of an eroded dome is East of the R. Wye 6 miles from Hereford. Overlying red marls have been removed exposing hard Silurian Limestones in wooded ridges, valleys have been formed in softer grey shales. The oldest exposed strata Llandovery sandstones are at Haugh Wood (NT) & Broadmoor Common 167m, the centre of the dome. Notable gaps in the ridges as at Pentaloe are the result of faulting. Splendid views over the dome to Orcop Hill and the Welsh Mountains from Hooper's Oak 0363102354 and Sleave's Oak 0363902345.
